title: Can shap handle SparseTensor in Tensorflow input?
body:
I build a wide & deep model by tensorflor for Recomendation System. Now, I want to know why it works. But I have some tf.SparseTensor input(shape, values, indices). However, if I put these input PlaceHolder, the shap_values() will crash.
Is there some ways to solve it.

[Input tensor]
**_(2,) 
(141484,)
(141484, 2)
(2,)
(33790,)
(33790, 2)
(2,)
(8192,)
(8192, 2)
(2,)
(64686,)
(64686, 2)
(2,)
(2048,)
(2048, 2)_**  4 SparseTensor with shape, values, indices
(1024, 32)
(1024, 64)
(1024, 22)
(1024, 1)
(1024, 1)
(1024, 1)
(1024, 1)
(1024, 30)
(1024, 30)
(1024, 30)
(1024, 30)
(1024, 30)

TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-141-93060ec64da5> in <module>
    114     explainer = shap.GradientExplainer(model=(inputs, pred_score), data=X_input, session=sess)
    115 
--> 116     shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_input, nsamples=1024)

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/gradient.py in shap_values(self, X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
    104         were chosen as "top".
    105         """
--> 106         return self.explainer.shap_values(X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
    107 
    108 

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/gradient.py in shap_values(self, X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
    251                         else:
    252                             x = X[l][j]
--> 253                         samples_input[l][k] = t * x + (1 - t) * self.data[l][rind]
    254                         samples_delta[l][k] = x - self.data[l][rind]
    255 

TypeError: can't multiply sequence by non-int of type 'float'
